text: Moritz Heyne Moritz Heyne (June 8, 1837 in Weißenfels – March 1, 1906 in Göttingen) was a German Germanic linguist (Germanist). He taught as a professor at the University of Halle (1869-1870), University of Basel (1870-), University of Göttingen (1883-). He worked with Jakob Grimm to edit his dictionary after 1867. == Literary works == * Laut- und Flexionslehre der altgermanischen Dialekte, 1862 * Beowulf: Angelsächsisches Heldengedicht, 1863 * Heliand, 1866 * Deutsches Wörterbuch, 3 vols., 1890-1895 * Ruodlieb, 1897 Category:1837 births Category:1906 deaths Category:Germanists Category:Linguists of Germanic languages Heyne Moritz Category:University of Göttingen faculty
title: Moritz Heyne
